reasoning: Parathyroid hyperplasia is a specific histological presentation of hyperparathyroidism (accounts for ~20% of primary cases, more common in secondary forms). Reported prevalence estimated at 2-3 per 100k based on surgical cohorts and autopsy studies. Limited population-based epidemiological data; prevalence metric used as this is a chronic endocrine condition.
source: Based on surgical epidemiology and case series prevalence estimates; specific population-based registry data not readily available for this condition.
